intro: Scutellaria orientalis subsp. carica, commonly known as the oriental skullcap, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to regions of Central Asia and parts of Eastern Europe. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring square stems and opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, two-lipped, blue to purple flowers arranged in whorled clusters along the stem. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
